definitions.definition: a large crowd of people, especially one that may become violent or cause trouble

examples.text: The mob was/were preparing to storm the building.
**mob rule** *(= a situation in which a  has control, rather than people in authority)
the lawless days of mob rule and anarchy
An angry mob of demonstrators came charging around the corner.
He was greeted by a mob of well-wishers eager to shake his hand.
Let's get out of here before the mob gets out of control.

definitions.definition: a group of people who are similar in some way

examples.text: All the usual mob were there.

definitions.definition: the people involved in organized crime; the Mafia
a group of strong, often violent people employed to do something such as protect somebody

wordOrigin: late 17th cent.: abbreviation of archaic mobile, short for Latin mobile vulgus ‘excitable crowd’.
